question:
You rent an apartment and recently a new neighbor has moved in who lives above you. They are making a lot of noise and this is disturbing you.

Write a letter to your landlord. In your letter: 

Explain what the problem is
Explain why it is disturbing you so much
Tell your landlord what you would like him/her to do about it
text: I am writing to let you know that I am totally annoyed with the new neighbour who has been started to live near to my apartment since December.

Let me explain my situation. As you know, I have a family of 3 including my younger daughter, who is just 6 months old. The problem is that, my new neighbour is creating so many problems, including, plays music loudly at night on a regular basis. This creates a lot of nuisance to us. Moreover, my daughter is often crying after hearing the loud noise.

Would you please do the needful to rectify this issue as soon as possible. So that we can live there peacefully. Apart from that we are enjoying staying here, because this place has such a captivating ambience and all the amenities are wonderful too. I suggest you to please allow us to move to the apartment near to the river or leave that man from there.
I look forward to hearing from you.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you have an unnecessary comma after the subordinating conjunction that. Consider removing the comma.
Consider using a question mark to signify that this sentence is a question.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker because. Consider removing the comma.
It seems that the use of particle to may be incorrect here.
